## ðŸ•µ Final check
- [ ] **Integrity check**: There should be no broken links or inaccessible references in the content you add or update. Please check and fix the corresponding errors in the GitHub Action task before submitting the PR.
- [ ] **Authenticity**: We encourage transparent and authentic communication. Please do not post false or misleading information. Use of content derived from generative AI should follow [Guidelines for the Administrative Use of Generative Artificial Intelligence at Northeastern](https://uds.northeastern.edu/news/guidelines-for-the-administrative-use-of-generative-artificial-intelligence-at-northeastern/).
- [ ] **Privacy protection**: Please protect the privacy of yourself and others. Do not share any sensitive personal information publicly, including but not limited to addresses, phone numbers, email addresses, and Social Security numbers, unless you have carefully considered doing so.
- [ ] **Legal compliance**
  - [ ] **Intellectual Property Protection**: Content posted must be something you own or have the right to use. This includes, but is not limited to, text, images, audio, and video. Please ensure that you have permission to share the content and do not infringe others' copyrights, trademarks, patents, or other intellectual property rights.
  - [ ] **Comply with Laws and Regulations**: Please ensure that the content you post complies with all applicable national, state, and local laws, including but not limited to anti-discrimination, privacy, and anti-defamation laws.
  - [ ] **NU-related policies**: Northeastern University encourages and expects all members of the community to conduct themselves according to the highest ethical standards. When posting content you should comply with the policies outlined in [University Policies](https://policies.northeastern.edu/).
- [ ] **Accessible website construction**: [Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)(https://www.w3.org/WAI/standards-guidelines/wcag/) recommends that content creators should "Add proper alt text to images.", "Use text, not pictures of text.", and "Create accessible documents.".
